articles.title: SWiRL: The business case for AI that thinks like your best problem-solvers

articles.summary: Step-Wise Reinforcement Learning (SWiRL) is a new AI technique developed by Stanford University and Google DeepMind. It aims to enhance the ability of large language models (LLMs) to tackle complex tasks requiring multi-step reasoning and tool use.

articles.author: Derek B. Johnson
articles.summary: GPT-4.1 is the latest family of generative AI models from OpenAI. It's the first model released by the company since it announced changes to the way it tests and evaluates products for safety. Researchers at SplxAI used the same prompts from their 4.0 tests to create a financial advisor chatbot programmed with 11 'core security directives' across 11 different categories. Results of safety tests across 11 categories using the same prompt found higher error rates across 4.1.
